Description

The LAMP stack is a classic, battle-tested architecture for hosting dynamic websites and content management systems like WordPress, Drupal, or custom PHP applications.

It relies on Linux as the OS, Apache as the web server, MySQL (or MariaDB) for relational data, and PHP as the scripting language.

Tech Stack

Component Technology
App PHP / WordPress
Web Apache
Db MySQL / MariaDB
Os Linux

System Components

The following distinct entities are defined in this architecture:

Component Type Notes
Web Visitors actor Public Traffic
Virtual Machine compute Linux (Ubuntu/Debian)
Apache HTTPD network Web Server + ModPHP
PHP Application container WordPress / Custom
MySQL / MariaDB database Relational Database
Local Filesystem storage /var/www/html

-
-
